intro: Eriolithis, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its showy, yellow or gold-colored composite flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats, such as marshes and wetlands, and is native to North America. Eriolithis has feathery, grass-like leaves and is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ecological benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species for supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
